definition: to master the subject via a comprehensive study of surrounding areas
to melt/to thaw/to blend/to merge/to be in harmony
old variant of 融[rong2]
to balance an account/accountancy/accounting
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
to pierce through/to pass through/to be stringed together/string of 1000 cash
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)

sentences.english: I cannot digest all this information.
sentences.chinese: 我不能将所有的信息融会贯通。

sentences.english: It studies the book methodology concentrated expression is"achieves mastery through a comprehensive study"the thought and the method.
sentences.chinese: 其学书方法论集中表现为“融会贯通”的思想和方法。

sentences.english: Jedi Knight's attunement to the Force more than compensates for these compromises.
sentences.chinese: 绝地武士对原力的融会贯通更能弥补这些不足。

sentences.english: He believes understanding, rather than memorization, is the most important part of studying.
sentences.chinese: 他相信学习之道在乎融会贯通，而非强记背诵。

sentences.english: Do not count on last minute cramming right before exams to do well.
sentences.chinese: 不要考试前的最后工夫里靠融会贯通去取的好成绩。

definition: to comprehend (new things) by analogy
to blend/to integrate/to amalgamate/to fuse
to have a fluent command of (idiom)
to understand/to comprehend
to study sth to apply it/study for practical applications
grasp this fundamental point and all the rest will follow (idiom)
to understand/to comprehend/to grasp
to experience/to realize/to comprehend
quintessence/essentials
to raise one and infer three/to deduce many things from one case (idiom)
marrow/pith/quintessence/essence
to fully grasp/to penetrate
fusion/to combine as one
to comprehend (the nature of things etc)/to achieve enlightenment
to learn/to acquire (some skill through practice)/acquisition
refined/profound
